keyFacts: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating a matter referred to as the 'Noel/Thomas case' as of July 2021.
A key point of investigation was a camera system failure; an electronics technician claimed it was due to an outdated system and not intentional sabotage, as no one had access to the camera room.
The investigation aimed to identify supervisors and their knowledge of the camera issues, including any requests or plans to replace the system.
The OIG planned to contact Mark Epstein's attorney, not to provide updates, but to offer to receive any information Mark Epstein wished to share.
